seo.title: AI Document Processing for Product Liability Litigation — Dodonai
seo.description: Process discovery documents, medical records from injury claims, and expert deposition transcripts in product liability cases. AI-powered summaries and chronologies. HIPAA compliant. Try free.

hero.headline: AI Document Processing for Product Liability Attorneys
hero.subheadline: Product liability cases demand rapid analysis of complex discovery sets — from corporate manufacturing documents and regulatory filings to plaintiff medical records and expert witness depositions. Dodonai processes these documents at scale, delivering organized summaries, medical chronologies, and searchable text so your team can build stronger cases faster.

sections.heading: Why Product Liability Firms Need AI Document Processing
paragraphs: Product liability litigation is document-intensive on both sides of the case. Design defect under risk-utility, manufacturing defect, failure to warn — whatever the theory, the discovery phase produces enormous volumes of records — corporate emails, engineering specifications, quality control logs, regulatory submissions, and internal testing data from the defendant, alongside plaintiff medical records, treatment histories, and expert reports. The attorneys and paralegals who can process this material efficiently are the ones who find the evidence that proves the case.

Manual document review in product liability cases isn't just slow — it's a strategic risk. When your team is buried in thousands of pages of medical records or wading through dozens of 30(b)(6) deposition transcripts from corporate designees, critical details get missed. A treating physician's note about the mechanism of injury, a quality engineer's admission about a known defect, a gap in the defendant's production that suggests documents were withheld — these are the facts that shape case outcomes, and they are easy to overlook in a manual review process.

Dodonai gives product liability teams the tools to process both sides of the case file. Upload plaintiff medical records and receive detailed {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|medical chronologies}} that document the full injury timeline with source citations — the foundation for your damages case and your specific causation experts. Upload deposition transcripts from 30(b)(6) corporate designees, retained experts, and treating physicians and get {{link:/deposition-summary-software/|structured deposition summaries}} organized by topic or page-line reference. Run scanned manufacturing documents and regulatory filings through {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI-powered OCR}} to make every page searchable and ready for {{link:/electronic-discovery-software/|e-discovery}} workflows. All processing is HIPAA compliant, SOC 2 Type II certified, and encrypted with AES-256.

cards.title: Medical Chronologies for Injury Claims
cards.description: Generate comprehensive medical chronologies documenting the plaintiff's injury, treatment, surgeries, and recovery timeline. Each entry includes source-page citations so attorneys can verify details when drafting complaints, responding to motions, or preparing for trial.

cards.title: Deposition Summaries for Corporate and Expert Witnesses
cards.description: Process transcripts from 30(b)(6) corporate designee depositions, retained expert testimony, and treating physician depositions into structured summaries. Choose page-line or narrative format and add key topics — design decisions, testing protocols, regulatory compliance, failure-to-warn evidence — to focus the AI on the issues that matter for your theory of liability.

cards.title: AI OCR for Manufacturing and Regulatory Records
cards.description: Product liability discovery often includes scanned engineering drawings, handwritten quality control logs, and older regulatory filings. Dodonai's {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI OCR}} extracts text from these documents so your team can search, summarize, and cross-reference them alongside digital records.

cards.title: Organize Large Discovery Sets
cards.description: Product cases involving corporate defendants can produce tens of thousands of pages under protective order. Dodonai helps your team process and organize these documents into searchable, summarized outputs — making it faster to identify the internal communications, testing data, and regulatory submissions that support your design defect, manufacturing defect, or failure-to-warn theory.

cards.title: Enterprise-Grade Security for Sensitive Case Files
cards.description: Product liability cases involve confidential medical records, proprietary manufacturing data, and documents subject to protective orders. Dodonai is SOC 2 Type II certified, HIPAA compliant, encrypts all data with AES-256, and never uses your documents to train AI models.

items.title: Upload Discovery Documents and Medical Records
items.description: Upload plaintiff medical records, deposition transcripts, corporate discovery documents, or expert reports to Dodonai's secure platform. The system accepts PDFs of any size, including scanned and image-based files, and processes them without manual preprocessing.

items.title: AI Extracts, Summarizes, and Organizes
items.description: Dodonai's AI reads through each document set, extracts key information — medical events, deposition testimony, document metadata — and produces structured outputs. Medical records become chronologies with provider timelines. Depositions become page-line or narrative summaries. Scanned documents become searchable text. You can specify key topics like product defect type, causation, or damages categories to guide the AI's focus.

items.title: Review, Export, and Build Your Case
items.description: Review all outputs in the interactive viewer with side-by-side source linking. Export finished summaries, chronologies, and extracted text as PDF, Word, or Excel files. Use the organized outputs for demand letters, expert report preparation, mediation briefs, and trial exhibits.

faq.question: How does Dodonai help product liability attorneys process medical records?
faq.answer: Dodonai processes plaintiff medical records and generates detailed {{link:/ai-medical-record-summaries-chronologies/|medical chronologies}} that document the injury, every treatment, surgery, medication, and provider visit in chronological order. Each entry includes a source-page citation, so attorneys can quickly verify details when drafting complaints, preparing experts, or building damages presentations.

faq.question: Can Dodonai summarize depositions from corporate representatives and expert witnesses?
faq.answer: Yes. Dodonai processes deposition transcripts from any witness — 30(b)(6) corporate designees, retained and non-retained experts, treating physicians, or fact witnesses — and produces {{link:/deposition-summary-software/|structured summaries}} in page-line or narrative format. You can add key topics to focus the summary on product design decisions, manufacturing quality control, risk-utility considerations, or failure-to-warn evidence.

faq.question: How does Dodonai handle scanned manufacturing documents in discovery?
faq.answer: Product liability discovery frequently includes scanned engineering drawings, quality control logs, and regulatory filings. Dodonai's {{link:/ai-pdf-ocr/|AI-powered OCR}} extracts text from scanned and image-based PDFs, making them fully searchable. This eliminates the need for a separate OCR step before document review.

faq.question: Is Dodonai secure enough for documents under protective orders?
faq.answer: Yes. Dodonai is SOC 2 Type II certified and HIPAA compliant. All data is encrypted with AES-256 in transit and at rest. Your documents are never used to train AI models, and you retain full control over data retention and deletion. These controls meet the security standards required for handling documents subject to protective orders and confidentiality agreements.

faq.question: What does product liability document processing cost with Dodonai?
faq.answer: Dodonai uses credit-based pricing where 1 credit equals approximately 1 page. Per-page costs range from $0.15 on the Lite plan down to $0.02 on the Pro plan, with Enterprise pricing available for larger volumes. Compare that to outsourced document review services at $5 to $15 per page for medical records alone — and product liability discovery often involves far more than medical records.
